content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)
Use-case: Converts iron ore into iron plates.  
This furnace was used by inserting iron ore and coal to yield additional iron plates.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(-27.0, -60.0)
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates.  
This furnace handled copper ore and coal inputs to produce copper plates.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Call Consistency  
  – When invoking get_entities(), ensure that the call conforms to its defined signature. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. using ‘radius’ led to unexpected keyword errors) and supplying positional arguments if none are accepted.

• Handling Null Returns  
  – Always verify that the output from functions (such as get_entities()) is not None before attempting to iterate or filter results to prevent type errors with NoneType.

• Entity Placement and Crafting Prerequisites  
  – Before attempting to place or craft a Lab, confirm that the required inventory item is available. Repeated errors showed placement attempts failing due to ‘No lab in inventory’.  
  – Ensure that the necessary sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, copper cables) are produced in sufficient quantities before initiating lab crafting.

• Resource Management  
  – Plan preceding resource processing (e.g. smelting ore into plates) to meet all intermediary requirements. This prevents crafting failures caused by missing ingredients needed for complex items like labs.
